H0.text: An increase in heart rate is the stimulus to which the body responds when a student practicing for the outdoor track team begins to sweat.

H1.text: An increase in body temperature is the stimulus to which the body responds when a student practicing for the outdoor track team begins to sweat.

H2.text: An increase in oxygen demand is the stimulus to which a student practicing for the outdoor track team responds when he begins to sweat.

H3.text: An increase in breathing rate is the stimulus to which the body responds when a student practicing for the outdoor track team begins to sweat.

A4.text: Evaporation of water helps in cooling body temperature to within the organism's tolerance range.

A5.text: During intense physical activity, evaporation becomes the main avenue of heat loss.
